revised_title: Observations on Blood Circulation and Stagnation in Tadpoles
tldr: The author observed the circulation and stagnation of blood in tadpoles, discovering that blood vessels expand and contract with each heartbeat, allowing blood to flow and circulate. This process can restore motion to stagnant blood, suggesting that coagulated blood from injuries can be loosened and the blood's natural motion restored over time.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Animal Physiology
